result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Franklin Michels was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua Franklin Michels is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua Franklin Michels was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-IMPOSED/STAYED.
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Consecutive to: 14CF260

superMiscConds.notes:
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Regular and random testing.
-Not to asscoiate with any persons known or suspected to be involoved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Participate in MRT programming through the jail.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
AODA and any follow through with any prgramming recommended by Agent.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson DF: Joshua Franklin Michels appeared from jail. Author/Agent of PSI in court. Case called at 10:13. Includes 14CF260, 14CF380.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. PSI has been completed. Atty Harrelson addresses PSI, no corrections. Sentencing arguments. There is a joint recommendation. DE makes statement. Compass has been completed. 

In 14CF260
Count 1- total confinement of 3 yrs. 6 mo. 
              - 1 year 6 mo. initial confinement 2 years ES- I/S  
             
Count 2 - total confinement of 9 years
              -  4 years initial confinement 5 years ES- I/S and concurrent with count 1          
Conditions of ES and probation:
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- AODA and any follow through with any programing recommended by agent.
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Regular and random testing. 
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Participate in MRT programing through jail. 
- DE not to posess a firearm 
- DNA sample and pay surcharges 
- $400 restitution for 14CF525
- Apply bond on file.
- Costs

In 14CF380
- 4 years total confinement 
- 1 year initial 3 years ES I/S consescutive to Ct. 1 and 5 of 14CF260.
Conditions of ES and probation:
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- AODA and any follow through with any programing recommended by agent.
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Regular and random testing. 
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Participate in MRT programing through jail. 
- DE not to posess a firearm 
- DNA sample and pay surcharges 
- Apply bond on file.
- Costs

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson DF:  Joshua Franklin Michels appeared from jail.  Includes 14CF260, 14CF380, 14CF381, 14CF481,14CF482,14CF490,14CF525, 14CF439, 14CM194, 14CM291, 14TR2825, 14TR2826, 14TR2827, 14TR2970, 14TR4419, 14TR4420 and 14TR5662. Case called at 8:09. ADA McKinley updates the court and makes joint recommendations.  Victim's rights have been complied with. Court questions 14CF260 amended information adding the count 5- possession with intent to deliver  psilocin/psilocybin <100g. 961.41 (am)(g)1 class G felony. There is no objection to the added count 5. ADA McKinley signs the amended information. Court allows the filing of the second information. DE understands the restitution of $19 in 14CF439 has been paid through the jail kiosk. 

Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct. 1 and NC to Ct. 5 in 14CF260 and G to Ct.1 in 14CF380. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 and 5 in 14CF260 and Ct. 1 in 14CF380. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2, 3, 4 in 14CF260. Ct. 2, 3, 4 in 14CF380. Court reads in and dismisses Ct. 1 in 14CF525 for restitution only and outright dismisses Ct. 2, 3, 4,5 and 6 in 14CF525. Court dismisses 14CF381, 14CF439, 14CF481, 14CF482, 14CF490, 14CM194 and 14CM291. 14TR2825, 14TR2826, 14TR2827, 14TR2970, 14TR4419, 14TR4420 and 14TR5662 are all dismissed. Court orders a PSI to be completed by April 30,2015.  Bail revoked. Any money should be maintained by the clerk pending sentencing. Atty's are to calculate credit and have dates available.  
DE remanded into St. Croix County Jail.  
Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.
From Atty Harrelson requesting to have Judge Needham hear all cases for the plea hearing. OK per EJL on 02-23-15. OK per EFV on 02-24-15. hml

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Fox, ADA: Amber L Hahn, DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson, DF:  Joshua Franklin Michels appeared from jail. Includes MH for 14CF260 and status for 14CF380, 14CF381, 14CM194, 14CM291, 14TR2825, 14TR2826, 14TR2827, 14TR2970, 14TR4419 and 14TR4420. Court notes pending files in branch 1 & 3 and multiple Attorney's representing defendant. 
RE: Motion hearing for case 14CF260 - S/T. Officer K. Chevrier. Direct by ADA Hahn. Cross by Attorney Jeremiah Harrelson. DE exhibit #1; O/R. Redirect. S/T Officer de la Cruz. Direct by ADA Hahn. Redirect. Court denies motions. Attorney's to schedule with JA for a trial.

**BOND AMENDED**

Includes 14CF260, 14CF380, 14CF381 and 14CM291.

*Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
*Random Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test.
*DE to report to SCC jail for regular testing every Saturday by 5:00 p.m. and report current address to the SCC jail. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test.
*DE not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
*It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Heather M.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
